contributor: joseph meredith toner collection (library of congress)
description: 241 U.S. Copyright Office Relief shown by hachures. Shows troop positions of the Union and Confederate forces. "Entered according to act of Congress in the year 1863 by T. Ditterline in the Clerk's Office of the Dist. Court of the East. Dist. of Pa." Folded map was originally attached to inside of back cover of the accompanying text. Accompanied by text: Sketch of the battles of Gettysburg : July 1st, 2d, and 3d, 1863 : with an account of the movements of the respective armies for some days previous thereto : compiled from the personal observation of eye-witnesses of the several battles : accompanied by an explanatory map / by T. Ditterline. 24 p. ; 19 cm. Includes text titled "Remarks". Available also through the Library of Congress Web site as a raster image. This ed. related to citation no. 331 in CW2 bibliography (NDL). LC copy trimmed, torn along fold lines, missing small sections at fold-line crosses, taped on verso along fold lines. LC accompanying text pressed in rice paper, annotated in ink on t.p., missing sections of cover. Original classification of LC text: E475.53.D61. Vault LAC nsk 2020-09-14 update (1 card) CW3

call_number: E475.53 .D61 Copy 2 Sketch of the battles of Gettysburg, July 1st, 2d, and 3d, 1863 : with an account of the movements of the respective armies for some days previous thereto. Compiled from the personal observation of eye-witnesses of the several battles. Accompanied by an explanatory map / by T. Ditterline. 24 p. front. (fold. map) ; 18 cm.

description: Annotated in blue ink to show Union lines, in red ink to show Rebel lines, and blue and red ink to show lines of Union forces captured by the Rebels. Hachures added in black ink. Relief shown by hachures, contours, and spot heights. Civil War salted paper maps. LC Civil War maps (2nd ed.) 427.1, S167 LC copy annotated in ink at head of title: No. 22. LC copy imperfect: Torn in upper left corner. Available also through the Library of Congress Web site as a raster image.

call_number: G3964.K7S5 1864 .R6 Copy 2. Scale ca. 1:20,400. 33 x 37 cm.  "This copy made for Lieut. Gen. U.S. Grant by order of Maj. Genl. J.G. Foster."  "Rebel works & lines" and "Rebel rifle pits" are red; "Federal works & lines" and "rifle pits" are blue; and "rifle pits, held first by one party, and afterwards by the other" are blue and red.  Map includes roads, railroads, contour lines, vegetation, drainage, and houses.  LC Civil War maps (2nd ed.), S167, 428.
medium: 1 map : photocopy, mounted on linen ; 33 x 38 cm.
notes: Annotated in blue ink to show Union lines, in red ink to show Rebel lines, and blue and red ink to show lines of Union forces captured by the Rebels. Hachures added in black ink.
Relief shown by hachures, contours, and spot heights.
Civil War salted paper maps.
LC Civil War maps (2nd ed.) 427.1, S167

description: Relief shown by hachures. On the lower left edge: Rikugun Bunko. Reinforced on edges with cloth. Available also through the Library of Congress Web site as a raster image. Includes note and 4 insets. Accompanied by photocopy of letter, dated Sept. 1st, 1876, from K. Amano, attaché to the Japanese Legation, to General Poe. Gaihozu.
